info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:19PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Pershing County through 815 PM PDT... At 714 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along Interstate 80 near Lovelock. Storms will continue to migrate northeast at 20 mph along and near the Interstate. HAZARD...Blowing dust with reduced visibility followed by localized heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar, airport, and webcam observations. IMPACT...Blowing dust may reduce visibility down to less than a mile at times along Interstate 80. Localized moderate to heavy rainfall may follow the haze and blowing dust. Locations impacted include... Lovelock, Oreana, Unionville, Junction I 80 And Nv 396/857 (exit 112), Rye Patch Reservoir, Rye Patch Reservoir Campground, Buffalo Mountain and Trinity Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Reduce driving speeds and increase braking distance if you are traveling along Interstate 80 east of Lovelock. Sudden visibility reductions due to blowing dust and heavy rain are possible.
